Articles.Content:
Recently, I've been transferring a group of stranded Kerbals across the Munar plain to a waiting rescue vessel. It's taking a significant amount of time, partly due to the distance from the wrecks to the rescue vessel, and partly because there are six Kerbals to move by EVA... Sort of wishing I could tell this group of three to move together, and then that group of three to move together, for instance, turning six individual EVA movements into two.

(Yeah, I know I could've landed closer, but that's just how it worked out.)
I think that's not a bad idea at all. I'm not sure that I would use it, but I see where it could be useful, as you said.

Try EVA Follower:

It is outdated, no idea if it work with latest KSP.

Edited May 5, 2021 by Snark
Link to defunct website removed by moderator

winged said:
Try EVA Follower:

It is outdated, no idea if it work with latest KSP.

The issue with EVA follower is that it doesn't support RCS on eva. I did download the source code and build it once, and it worked on RCS, but it is so buggy, and it allows you to remove helmets while in space(not a good idea) They also stand and walk in space.

If you want 'My' build of it go here.

Fel updated it, heres the link

https://www.dropbox.com/s/o0u3ws6kshsgfl5/EVAFollowers%20-%20MCD%20-%20Patched.zip
